abstract: Sets the tint color within this view.

declaration.code: nonisolated func tint(_ tint: Color?) -> some View

overview:
## Discussion

Use this method to override the default accent color for this view. Unlike an app’s accent color, which can be overridden by user preference, the tint color is always respected and should be used as a way to provide additional meaning to the control.

This example shows Answer and Decline buttons with [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/ShapeStyle/green] and [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/ShapeStyle/red] tint colors, respectively.

Some controls adapt to the tint color differently based on their style, the current platform, and the surrounding context. For example, in macOS, a button with the [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/PrimitiveButtonStyle/bordered] style doesn’t tint its background, but one with the [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/PrimitiveButtonStyle/borderedProminent] style does. In macOS, neither of these button styles tint their label, but they do in other platforms.

items.description: A representation of a color that adapts to a given context.
